definition: to stand firm
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website
settled/steady/stable
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to gain a firm foothold/(fig.) to get oneself established

sentences.english: The PLA Air Force small test their skills in front of a firm footing.
sentences.chinese: 解放军空军小试身手，在前线站稳了脚跟。

sentences.english: He straightened himself up, and rooted himself upon that point of support with a sort of fury.
sentences.chinese: 他竖起身来又弯下去，拚命在这个支点上站稳。

sentences.english: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
sentences.chinese: 确认你的起点无虑，然后站稳脚步。
照马司模所言，那就是“我们要在这里站稳脚跟”。

sentences.english: Pray for Naxi believers to stand on God our Rock.
sentences.chinese: 愿纳西族基督徒站稳在我们的上帝磐石上。

sentences.english: She lost her balance and plunged 100 feet to her death.
sentences.chinese: 她没有站稳，从100英尺的高处跌下摔死了。

sentences.english: The firm won't regain its footing until the economy rebounds.
sentences.chinese: 直到经济反弹之前该公司都无法站稳脚跟。

sentences.english: Flexible non-slip outsole is durable and textured for sure footing with each step.
sentences.chinese: 灵活的防滑大底是耐用和质感的每一步站稳脚跟。

sentences.english: By the end arguably the world's best centre-forward could hardly stand.
sentences.chinese: 最终，这位世界上最好的中锋在场上几乎无法站稳。

sentences.english: Stand strong in the knowledge that the battle belongs to the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 既知道胜利必定属于耶和华，我们自当刚强站稳。

sentences.english: back when America was first getting its feet and like, started to write its own literature.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候的美国刚刚站稳脚跟准备创作自己的文学。

sentences.english: Define your personal stance towards the issues raised in the readings.
sentences.chinese: 从阅读引发的议题，必须站稳立场。

sentences.english: I need you to stand up for me.
sentences.chinese: 我需要你为我站稳立场。

sentences.english: The newly-founded branch of Microsoft Company quickly took hold in Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 微软公司的洛杉矶分部很快在当地站稳了脚跟。

sentences.english: Notwithstanding all these still existing reservations, electronic publications have been able to gain a foothold in the humanities over the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 尽管这些议题存在多年，电子出版品已经站稳立场。

sentences.english: Flexible non-slip PU outsole is durable and textured for sure footing with each step.
sentences.chinese: 灵活的防滑PU大底是耐用和质感的每一步站稳脚跟。

to step on/to tread/to stamp/to press a pedal/to pedal (a bike)/(online) to downvote
to prop up/to support/strut/brace
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
down/downward
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to vibrate/to shake/to shudder
to stand
to borrow sb's authority/to seize an opportunity
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to stand/to have a footing/to be established/to base oneself on
to counterattack/a counteroffensive
upward/up/to advance/to try to improve oneself/to make progress
to leave (a room etc)/to go out through (a door etc)
